protocol_name: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
protocol_name_html: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
description: This protocol is for isolation of high quality, high molecular weight DNA (20 kb and larger) that is suitable for PacBio library preparation. This protocol has been tested on lyophilized conidia from multiple isolates of Fusarium oxysporum, including f. sp. apii, f. sp. ciceris, and f. sp. lycopersici.
before_start: Buffered Phenol Chloroform Isoamyl alcohol (P:C:I) ((25:24:1, saturated with 10 mM Tris, pH 8.0 and 1 mM EDTA) (Sigma P2069) [Note: use stocks that are less than 3 months old]
protocol_affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

authors: Sukhwinder Kaur, Quyen Anh Pham, and Lynn Epstein

authors_list.name: Sukhwinder Kaur
authors_list.affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

authors_list.name: Quyen Anh Pham
authors_list.affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

authors_list.name: and Lynn Epstein
authors_list.affiliation: Dept. of Plant Pathology, University of California, Davis, CA, 95616 USA

guidelines:
• When pipetting solutions with high molecular weight DNA, use low retention pipet tips with ca. 2 mm of the ends removed, i.e., wide-bore tips.
  • Use low DNA-binding microfuge tubes.

Mixing is critical for purification, but avoid vigorous vortexing (which shears DNA)

 

We thank Martijn Rep, Benjamin Schwessinger, and Oanh Nguyen for advice. This protocol is modified from protocols from Dr. Martijn Rep, University of Amsterdam, and Dr. Benjamin Schwessinger, Australian National University.

components.data: Sterilize all dry supplies by autoclaving.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sterilize all dry supplies by autoclaving.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
source_data.protocol_name: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
source_data.protocol_name_html: High quality DNA from Fusarium oxysporum conidia suitable for library preparation and long read sequencing with PacBio
source_data.annotation:
Reagents required

Buffer -5X RNB

1M Tris-HCl pH 8.0

1.25 M NaCl

0.25 M EDTA

Autoclave and store at 4C

 

Other materials:

PAS-Sodium 4-aminosalicylate dehydrate, (Fluka Catalog # 09415)

TIPS -Triisopropylnaphthalenesulfonic acid sodium (Sigma Catalog # T8324)

 

Autoclaved, acid-washed sand (or J.T. Baker 3382-05 sand, washed and ignited for boats)

 

Buffered Phenol:Chloroform:Isoamyl alcohol (P:C:I) (25:24:1 P:C:I, saturated with 10 mM Tris, pH 8.0 and 1 mM EDTA) (Sigma P2069) [Note: use stocks that are less than 3 months old]

 

Chloroform:Isoamyl alcohol (24:1)

Sterile 4 M NaCl

Isopropanol (IPA) 100%

Ethanol 70% [Note: freshly prepared]

EB (Qiagen, Tris, pH 8.5)

Water refers to sterilized deionized water

 

AMPure XP magnetic beads (Beckman Coulter)

 Enzymes

RNase A 10mg/ml, DNase and Protease-free (Thermo Scientific EN0531)

Proteinase K (800U/ml = 20 mg/ml), New England BioLabs P8107S)

 

Equipment:

A vortexer with low speed (200 rpm) and a holder for horizontal microfuge tubes.

             Magna Rack Catalog # 15000 (Invitrogen)

source_data.annotation: The goal is to obtain ca. 0.5 ml packed conidial volume, which yields ca. 250 mg lyophilized conidia.
source_data.thread_text: The goal is to obtain ca. 0.5 ml packed conidial volume, which yields ca. 250 mg lyophilized conidia.
source_data.body: The goal is to obtain ca. 0.5 ml packed conidial volume, which yields ca. 250 mg lyophilized conidia.

components.data:
Use 1 ml of freshly prepared extraction buffer with RNase A per 50 mg of lyophilized Fusarium oxysporum conidia.

 

 

Prepare fresh just before extraction

For 5 ml extraction buffer add sequentially:

4 ml Milli-Q nuclease-free water

1 ml 5xRNB

240 mg PAS (Sodium 4-aminosalicylate dihydrate). Mix and then vortex until dissolved.

40 mg TIPS (Triisopropylnaphthalenesulfonic acid sodium) Mix and then vortex until dissolved.

Wait until the foam disappears. Add 5µl (50 µg) of RNase A (10mg/ml stock)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Use 1 ml of freshly prepared extraction buffer with RNase A per 50 mg of lyophilized Fusarium oxysporum conidia.

 

 

Prepare fresh just before extraction

For 5 ml extraction buffer add sequentially:

4 ml Milli-Q nuclease-free water

1 ml 5xRNB

240 mg PAS (Sodium 4-aminosalicylate dihydrate). Mix and then vortex until dissolved.

40 mg TIPS (Triisopropylnaphthalenesulfonic acid sodium) Mix and then vortex until dissolved.

Wait until the foam disappears. Add 5µl (50 µg) of RNase A (10mg/ml stock)

components.data: To harvest the conidia, from each dish, pour 5 ml water on the culture, and gently rub the culture with a metal “hockey stick.” Repeat conidial collection with an additional 5 ml water.

source_data.annotation: To optimize your grinding procedure, examine ground lyophilized conidia microscopically (Fig. 1); you need to grind sufficiently so that most of the conidia are cracked open. Any more grinding than that only shears the DNA.]

components.data: Bring AMpure beads suspension to RT.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bring AMpure beads suspension to RT.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Pipet out the beads slowly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipet out the beads slowly.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 0.45X or 0.5X volume of the AMpure beads to the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.45X or 0.5X volume of the AMpure beads to the DNA.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix the beads in the DNA solution thoroughly by flicking the tube. Do not vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the beads in the DNA solution thoroughly by flicking the tube. Do not vortex.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Collect but do not pellet the beads at 7,000 g for 2 to 3 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect but do not pellet the beads at 7,000 g for 2 to 3 sec.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Allow the DNA to bind to the beads by shaking at 200 rpm on a horizontal vortex mixer for 10 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow the DNA to bind to the beads by shaking at 200 rpm on a horizontal vortex mixer for 10 min.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate the tubes on a rotating wheel at 22 rpm for 20 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the tubes on a rotating wheel at 22 rpm for 20 min.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge tubes at 7000 g for 10 sec to pellet the beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge tubes at 7000 g for 10 sec to pellet the beads.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tubes in a magnetic rack to hold the pellet on the side of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tubes in a magnetic rack to hold the pellet on the side of the tube.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Slowly pipette off the SN.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly pipette off the SN.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: As a precautionary measure, save the SN in a new tube, but only as a backup–your DNA should be bound to the beads. Avoid disturbing the bead pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: As a precautionary measure, save the SN in a new tube, but only as a backup–your DNA should be bound to the beads. Avoid disturbing the bead pellet.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: With the beads in the magnetic rack, add 70% ethanol to the side of tube, i.e., avoid the pellet. Fill the 70% ethanol to the rim of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: With the beads in the magnetic rack, add 70% ethanol to the side of tube, i.e., avoid the pellet. Fill the 70% ethanol to the rim of the tube.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Pipette off the ethanol and wash again with 70% ethanol as above.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette off the ethanol and wash again with 70% ethanol as above.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove all the ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove all the ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove tubes from the magnetic rack.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove tubes from the magnetic rack.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec to collect the residual ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec to collect the residual ethanol.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Place tubes on the magnetic rack and remove the ethanol with a fine tip Pipette (P20 or P10).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place tubes on the magnetic rack and remove the ethanol with a fine tip Pipette (P20 or P10).

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Check for any ethanol droplets. If present, repeat the previous step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check for any ethanol droplets. If present, repeat the previous step.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Open the caps.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Open the caps.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Add the amount of EB for >100ng/µl DNA (by Qubit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add the amount of EB for >100ng/µl DNA (by Qubit).

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare fresh 70% EtOH.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare fresh 70% EtOH.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup.
components.name: Section

components.data: Discard the SN. Wash the pellet with 1.5 ml ice-cold 70% ethanol. Centrifuge at 13000g for 5 min at RT.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Discard the SN. Wash the pellet with 1.5 ml ice-cold 70% ethanol. Centrifuge at 13000g for 5 min at RT.

components.data:
Discard the SN. Wash the pellet with 1.5 ml ice-cold 70% ethanol. Centrifuge at 13000g for 5 min at RT.

Discard SN and centrifuge for 1 min at 13000g at RT. Remove residual ethanol with a fine Pippettor tip (e.g. P10 or P20).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Discard the SN. Wash the pellet with 1.5 ml ice-cold 70% ethanol. Centrifuge at 13000g for 5 min at RT.

Discard SN and centrifuge for 1 min at 13000g at RT. Remove residual ethanol with a fine Pippettor tip (e.g. P10 or P20).

components.data: Air dry the pellet for 15 to 20 min until there is no visible ethanol residue. Add 100 ul of EB (10mM Tris pH 8.5, Qiagen). Incubate at RT overnight. Next morning, incubate at 28 C on a platform orbit shaker at 150 rpm for 1 h.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Air dry the pellet for 15 to 20 min until there is no visible ethanol residue. Add 100 ul of EB (10mM Tris pH 8.5, Qiagen). Incubate at RT overnight. Next morning, incubate at 28 C on a platform orbit shaker at 150 rpm for 1 h.

components.data:
Determine the DNA concentration with a Nanodrop (ND) and by Qubit. The Nanodrop 260/280 ratio should be 1.8-1.9 and the 260/230 ratio should be >2. Based on Qubit, the DNA quantity should be >200ng/ul. At this point, the concentrations of Qubit /ND is often ca. 0.1.

[Note: further cleanup is required until the Qubit/ND ratio >0.7.]
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Determine the DNA concentration with a Nanodrop (ND) and by Qubit. The Nanodrop 260/280 ratio should be 1.8-1.9 and the 260/230 ratio should be >2. Based on Qubit, the DNA quantity should be >200ng/ul. At this point, the concentrations of Qubit /ND is often ca. 0.1.

[Note: further cleanup is required until the Qubit/ND ratio >0.7.]

components.data: Perform an AMpure bead cleanup using either a 0.45X or 0.5X volume of beads as indicated below. Elute in 50 to100 ul EB.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform an AMpure bead cleanup using either a 0.45X or 0.5X volume of beads as indicated below. Elute in 50 to100 ul EB.

components.data: AMpure Bead Cleanup
components.name: Section

components.data:
Based on Qubit, the DNA concentration should be >100ng/ul.

The size of the DNA should be checked by gel electrophoresis. We typically yield 80 ug DNA with mol wt. >48 kb per 250 mg lyophilized conidia.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Based on Qubit, the DNA concentration should be >100ng/ul.

The size of the DNA should be checked by gel electrophoresis. We typically yield 80 ug DNA with mol wt. >48 kb per 250 mg lyophilized conidia.

components.data: Bring AMpure beads suspension to RT. Pipet out the beads slowly. Add 0.45X or 0.5X volume of the AMpure beads to the DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bring AMpure beads suspension to RT. Pipet out the beads slowly. Add 0.45X or 0.5X volume of the AMpure beads to the DNA.

components.data: Mix the beads in the DNA solution thoroughly by flicking the tube. Do not vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix the beads in the DNA solution thoroughly by flicking the tube. Do not vortex.

components.data: Collect but do not pellet the beads at 7,000 g for 2 to 3 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect but do not pellet the beads at 7,000 g for 2 to 3 sec.

components.data: Allow the DNA to bind to the beads by shaking at 200 rpm on a horizontal vortex mixer for 10 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow the DNA to bind to the beads by shaking at 200 rpm on a horizontal vortex mixer for 10 min.

components.data: Incubate the tubes on a rotating wheel at 22 rpm for 20 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the tubes on a rotating wheel at 22 rpm for 20 min.

components.data: Centrifuge tubes at 7000 g for 10 sec to pellet the beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge tubes at 7000 g for 10 sec to pellet the beads.

components.data: Place the tubes in a magnetic rack to hold the pellet on the side of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the tubes in a magnetic rack to hold the pellet on the side of the tube.

components.data: Slowly pipette off the SN. As a precautionary measure, save the SN in a new tube, but only as a backup–your DNA should be bound to the beads. Avoid disturbing the bead pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly pipette off the SN. As a precautionary measure, save the SN in a new tube, but only as a backup–your DNA should be bound to the beads. Avoid disturbing the bead pellet.

components.data: With the beads in the magnetic rack, add 70% ethanol to the side of tube, i.e., avoid the pellet. Fill the 70% ethanol to the rim of the tube.10.	Pipette off the ethanol and wash again with 70% ethanol as above.  Remove all the ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: With the beads in the magnetic rack, add 70% ethanol to the side of tube, i.e., avoid the pellet. Fill the 70% ethanol to the rim of the tube.10.	Pipette off the ethanol and wash again with 70% ethanol as above.  Remove all the ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet.

components.data: Remove tubes from the magnetic rack and centrifuge briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec to collect the residual ethanol. Place tubes on the magnetic rack and remove the ethanol with a fine tip Pipette (P20 or P10).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove tubes from the magnetic rack and centrifuge briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec to collect the residual ethanol. Place tubes on the magnetic rack and remove the ethanol with a fine tip Pipette (P20 or P10).

components.data: Check for any ethanol droplets. If present, repeat the previous step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check for any ethanol droplets. If present, repeat the previous step.

components.data: Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack. Open the caps. Add the amount of EB for >100ng/ul DNA (by Qubit). Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous. Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec. Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes. When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack. Open the caps. Add the amount of EB for >100ng/ul DNA (by Qubit). Mix the EB and beads gently by flicking until the suspension is homogenous. Centrifuge the tubes briefly at 7000 g for 30 sec. Place the tubes in the magnetic rack and let the DNA elute off the beads for 5 to 10 minutes. When all the brown beads are on the side with the magnet, carefully and slowly remove the gDNA into a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Do not pipet out any of the magnetic beads.

components.data: Quantify DNA concentration and quality on Nanodrop and Qubit.  For sufficient quality, with Nanodrop, the 260/280 ratio should be between 1.7 to 1.9 and the 260/230 ratio should be higher than 2.0.  The Qubit/Nanodrop concentration ratio should be > 0.7X.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Quantify DNA concentration and quality on Nanodrop and Qubit.  For sufficient quality, with Nanodrop, the 260/280 ratio should be between 1.7 to 1.9 and the 260/230 ratio should be higher than 2.0.  The Qubit/Nanodrop concentration ratio should be > 0.7X.
